greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n into k parts x_1, x_2, ..., x_k such that gcd(x_1, x_2, ..., x_k) = 1 (where 1 <= k <= n).
comment: To base the triangle on (0, 0) a column (1, 0, 0, ...) has to be appended to the left hand side of the triangle. To compute this triangle with _Michael De Vlieger_'s Mathematica program only the ranges of the indices have to be adapted. The SageMath program computes the extended triangle by default. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 24 2019
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5050 (rows 1 <= n <= 100)
formula: T(n, k) = Sum_{d|n} Moebius(d) * A008284(n/d, k) for n >= 1, T(0, 0) = 1. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 24 2019
example: The partitions with their gcd value for n=8, k=2..5:
mathematica: Table[Length@ Select[IntegerPartitions[n, {k}], GCD @@ # == 1 &], {n, 13}, {k, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 08 2017 *)
xref: Cf. A023022-A023030, A101391 (analog for compositions), A282749 (triangle of partitions into pairwise relatively prime parts).
Row sums = A000837. See also A051424.
For ordinary partition table see A008284.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 05 2017
ext: Corrected a(30)-a(32) and more terms from _Lars Blomberg_, Mar 08 2017
